clinical_study.brief_title: The Association Between Blood Eosinophilsp in Thai COPD Patients: A Prospective Study
clinical_study.official_title: The Association Between Blood Eosinophils and Clinical Outcomes of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Patients: A Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The association of blood eosinophil as a biomarker for eosinophilic Thai COPD patients, such as COPD exacerbation, hospital admission, lung functions and mortlity.

detailed_description.textblock: The prospective one year study in Thai COPD patients for the clinical outcomes of COPD compare between eosinophilic and non-eosinophilic which determine by blood eosinophil counts equal or more than 300 cells/microliters. The primary outcomes was COPD exacerbation, the secondary outcomes were lung function, dyspnea and quality of life.

primary_outcome.description: acute severe worsening of respiratory symptoms

secondary_outcome.description: Forced expiratory volume in one second
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Assessment Test (CAT) scores which the minimum 0 and maximum 40 values, and whether higher scores mean a worse outcome.

arm_group.description: COPD patient with blood eosinophil equal or > 300 cells/µL
COPD patient with blood eosinophil < 300 cells/µL

study_pop.textblock: Thai COPD patients in out-patient department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of COPD by GOLD criteria
Exclusion Criteria:
1. high blood eosinophil from known causes such as systemic corticosteroid use, malignancy, parasitic infection
2. Patients who had previous acute exacerbation within 30-day before study entry
3. Patients who had previous systemic corticosteroids used within 30-day before study entry

facility.name: Faculty of Medicine, Prince of Songkla university

reference.citation: Bafadhel M, Pavord ID, Russell REK. Eosinophils in COPD: just another biomarker? Lancet Respir Med. 2017 Sep;5(9):747-759. doi: 10.1016/S2213-2600(17)30217-5. Epub 2017 Jun 7. Review. Erratum in: Lancet Respir Med. 2017 Aug;5(8):e28.
